intro: Elaeosticta transcaspica, commonly known as the Transcaspian elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in a dry, two-lobed fruit, and it is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
